titleStmt.title: Alfred McGlove, Sr. et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4592

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E Bramlett
Governor of the State of Kentucky

Whearas A certain Arnold Snider a young ^man^ about Eighteen or nineteen years of age Was sentenced to and ser confined in the Penatentiary of this state in 1862 for the crime of drowning a man by the of Jas Brigs and the sd Arnold Snider was as we believe wrongly con=convicted of said crime We your petitioners therefore pray your Excellency that you discharge the said Snider from confinement and let him go at liberty (the said Snider was convicted at Greenup County Ky.) and your petitioner will Ever pray this January 1864

Petitioners names
Alfred McGlove Sen
Edward Roe
Levy Yats
John Jordan
Joseph Jordan
T B Lawhan
John P webb
